H0.text: what was the title of the book charles darwin wrote. The Origin of Life

H1.text: what was the title of the book charles darwin wrote. Natural Selection

H2.text: what was the title of the book charles darwin wrote. The Species Book

H3.text: what was the title of the book charles darwin wrote. On evolution

A4.text: On the Origin of Species (or, more completely, On the Origin of Species by Means of Natural Selection, or the Preservation of Favoured Races in the Struggle for Life) is a work of scientific literature by Charles Darwin that is considered to be the foundation of evolutionary biology.

A5.text: In 1856, his 'big book on species' titled Natural Selection was to include a 'note on Man'
